answers.answer: As soon as you get back to your doctor, you will know if he is going to stick you in the hospital.  Doctor's don't fool around with this, so be prepared.  It's true that you can raise your blood pressure just by worrying, but you have had some signs of preeclampsia for a while now.  Especially all the swelling you have had.I really think it's time for you to take your maternity leave.  Can you swing it or do you have to work longer?  Taking time off now, would probably help your blood pressure and your blood sugars.I had preeclampsia with the first pregnancy and was placed in the hospital for one week in my 8th month to REST.  My pressure's did go down, but the swelling, the headache and the fatigue continued.  I carried the baby another 5 1/2 weeks after that.  Once the placenta was delivered the BP started to go down slowly.  They say it's the placenta that causes the high blood pressures and delivering the placenta is the "cure."You've been go, go, go with this pregnancy, after your early surgery and it's time for you to slow down.  You already know that, so I won't preach at you.  Sally it won't be long until the baby is here and you will be begging for some rest, so take advantage of it now.Keep us posted about your doctor visit.  I want to know what he says and does.Big Hugs and take care,Heather

Thanks Heather.I didn't get to see the doctor today.  Everyone is still on vacation leave here.I did however get the urine test and this time there is no protein (Whew!), but there is glucose (+++), so that's not so good.  I'll repeat the test in a couple of days anyway..... as I know it's supposed to be first morning urine....No maternity leave planned, but I'm on limited driving and no more site visits (my boss insisted after the China episode)... He wants me to make sure I have someone staying with me.... I don't but I'll tell my Filipina Mum about the episode and I know she will keep a close eye on me (she lives just in the next building).Anyway, I'm going to email doc mike my update, text the obe, and try to see the pulmonologist tomorrow (if he has clinic).... this cough / cold/ asthma, whatever it is is knocking me around a bit....

It seems like alot of mother's complain about colds, stuffiness and such during the last stages of pregnancy.  I had it with both babies.  I have exercise induced asthma, so all the coughing brought on some awful spells of breathlessness.  I wonder if this is happening to you?  As Quix told you, this is something that needs attention, as soon as you can get it.You are so good about keeping your doctor's informed that I am sure they will get to the bottom of this, as soon as possible.  It's real hard to go through this so late in pregnancy.  All that coughing really hurts with the baby taking up so much space.  I hope you feel better soon, Sally.  Please take care of yourself.Healing thoughts coming your way,Heather

Saw the pulmonologist today.  In addition to the asthma meds I've been given a course of antibiotics, plus am to take an oral bronchodilator twice a day / and as required.  Am looking forward to feeling better...Major tummy pain happening tonight - low right.  If this don't settle down soon I may just make a trip to the ER to get checked out...  Hope hope hope it settles...
Hope you feel better soon, you have alot on your plate. Take care of yourself, and take it easy..Ur gonna need your energy when your bundle fo jo arrive, do you have any help when the baby comes?

Thanks Layona.  Feeling like I'm heading towards being on the mend today.  Hopefully a lot better by tomorrow, when i've got to get back to work and lots of pending dramas there...Tummy pain settled.... I'll tell Obe about it tomorrow... but guess it's just one of those pregnancy things...I'll have help when baby comes.  My mum is arriving on 29th Jan (don't know if baby will last that long.....).... but also living in Philippines I will have hired help.  Interviewing at the moment....

question: Well,I may be paranoid, but I am so scared of getting preeclampsia.  I collapsed in China (hypoglycaemia) and they tested my urine and it  had protein.Now I've also been sick the past 2 weeks (really bad cough and reflux/hyperacidity), and have been monitoring my BP with a home monitor and it's been rising..... today was 130/90 (previously it was 100/60 usually).... I don't know if I am making it rise simply by being stressed about all this....Going home to Manila today.  Will go get another urine check straight away..... and chase up my doctor... am so scared of something going wrong at this stage.... probably that will make things worse.....Guess it's normal to be worrying at this stage....
title: preeclampsia
